snippet: Gov. Rick Perry offered up to $200,000 for information leading to the arrest and indictment of those responsible for the killings of two prosecutors and one’s wife.
abstract: Texas Gov Rick Perry offers up to $200,000 for information leading to the arrest and indictment of those responsible for the killings of Kaufman County prosecutor Mike McLelland, his wife Cynthia and another prosecutor, Mark E Hasse; reward, as well effort to publicize it, indicates lack of solid leads for investigators.

byline.original: By MANNY FERNANDEZ and SERGE F. KOVALESKI
byline.contributor: Manny Fernandez reported from Kaufman, and Serge F. Kovaleski from Dallas. Sheelagh McNeill contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Gov. Rick Perry offered up to $200,000 for information leading to the arrest and indictment of those responsible for the killings of two prosecutors and one’s wife.

headline.main: Reward Is Increased by Officials in Texas
headline.print_headline: Reward Is Increased By Officials In Texas
